reviews.review_msg: Hart is a person with great humor and personality, very knowledgeable and apporachable. However, his exam is more difficult than he desciribed: you need to read a lot and pay attention on all key concepts for the fill-blank and short answer questions. Final is much easier but requires heavier readings. overall, recommend.

Steve is an amazing lecturer. This was a seminar course on psychopathy (and he's a leading researcher in this field) so it was very interesting and engaging. He changed the term paper and presentation into a group presentationpaper, so that eased up my work load. Presentation ended up being a youtube vid introducing our paper topic to normal ppl.

This guy is one of the most engaging and entertaining profs in the school. Honestly, going to class was pointless except for the participation marks as the exams were 100% from the textbook. That being said, this guy is essentially a stand-up comedian up there! He is actually really funny! He'll make you love the course through his style and flair.

Total boss.  Lectures were interesting and full of awesome stories that were relevant to the course material.  Pretty much the only lecture that I fully enjoyed attending.  He tells you exactly what will be on the exam, and gives you the essay question.  All in all, a knowledgeable, friendly prof with a great sense of humor.

Prof  Hart is the BEST! Exams: super fair, straight out of the textbook. Lectures: interesting stories, even though exams were based out of the text i'd show up to class just to listen to Hart. He's super funny, easy to approach and an all around great guy. Take it with him if you can! Alana is a great TA as well.

He's fantastic! He clearly enjoys what he's doing, is more than happy to explain material and answer questions, and he wrote the textbook on Forensic Psychology -- Literally! I would take more forensic psyc classes just for him. His exams are really fair too.

I realized I screwed up my course sections on my last post. I took 268 with him not 250, and the last class I took with Hart was 379. Basically he teaches the Forensic Psyc classes! Seriously choose Hart over Deb Connolly!

Best professor I've ever had!! I was in his psyc 250 class as well. He provides the reading materials via pdf files (even the textbook he wrote), his lectures are engaging and interesting and he always has good stories to go along with the material. His exams are very fair as well! I seriously recommend taking a class with him!!

This guy is fantastic! His class is by no means an easy grade, but it's challenging and interesting. I learned a lot not just from his fantastic stories, but his great explanation of important points. Easily one of the professors I've had throughout University!
Absolutely amazing. He's hilarious!!! Best professor at SFU!

I find it funny that he has a hot chili pepper by his name. altho, i guess its his personality thats charming! he is VERY funny. every class is a riot, esp when he slips into swears. Very good prof, extremely fair exams, read the textbook that is the key! and dont be afraid to approach him to clarity things, hes very open and genuine.

Best prof I've had at SFU. He is hilarious! The class would be fairly boring if he wasn't the prof. He makes it incredibly interesting and gives lots of examples. The class has 2 midterms and a final. Memorize the text. Only complaint is the TM's marking. Definitely approach them about it if there are issues.

Good professor, exams are based out of the textbook (which he provided via PDF file, so we didn't have to purchase!) which was great! Funny and engages students. Good lectures, but can get away with not attending if you know your textbook material

Hart is great, you don't want to miss having him as a prof at some point while you're at SFU. Sometimes it feels more like you're watching stand-up than a lecture (in a good way). I found it pretty hard to get a decent mark in this class, and there were also issues around tests and marking in general. It was a GPA hurter for me but it was worth it.

Dr. Hart is one of the best lecturers at SFU. Unfortunately, this class was a disappointment. He didn't cover any of the material on the final in lecture. Instead, we got guest lectures on material that we had already been tested on, (coincidentally, his research area). We had to learn everything by ourselves from dense, theory-rich articles. C+.

Excellent teacher. Well-spoken, experienced, makes the material come alive. Too bad he doesn't mark the exams, as the TMs are limited in how they apply the marking guide. Tests are easy to do well on, hard to ace, but if you memorize the text, you can get full marks. One complaint - he is too busy to answer emails, it seems. But worth an8:30 wakeup

very good prof.  exams r pretty much based on the txtbook...so don't have to really go to class...however, lectures (and his stories) r pretty interesting.  class isn't very hard, just read and understand the material and u'll be fine.

This prof is SO GOOD. He tells the funniest stories and makes the material entertaining and interesting. Make sure you read the textbook because he doesn't cover everything in lecture. I am planning on taking more of Dr. Hart's classes.

Hart is the best professor on campus. He is witty, knowledgeable and very helpful. I have taken all the courses I can with him, including a directed studies - alll of which I would recommend to anyone. His classes are very comprehendable, and attending his lectures was actually a highlight of my day. TAKE HIS COURSES!

Dr. Hart is probably one of the best proffessors one could have in their whole university experience. He's funny, very well knowleged, and very very helpful. He is always available for help and he really does whatever he can to help his students. His lectures are interesting and his exams are fair.

Best professor ever! Made class interesting and just talked for 2 hours but his stories were funny! Only complainant about this course is that you do a group term paper and a group presentation in tutorial and I don't like group work.

He is a very entertaining and easy going prof. keeps you awake at 830. Material is interesting. One complain I have is that exams are very short-a 40% exam is only out of 40. The questions are also focused on little statistics.
Great prof! Very understanding and helpful, and also quite entertaining, even at 8:30 in the morning:) Very personable, I would take another class just because he was teaching it.

Great prof. When he said the exam is 1 hr long, he meant it (and gives you 2 hrs). Exams are easy if you have read the material. Very helpful and is willing to answer all kinds of questions. Lectures may be not very clearer for people who learn by reading, but it is fine for listeners.
He's awesome, totally funny guy.  Always available to answer questions and open to suggestions.
He's a hilarious man, but I still felt like I spent too much time laughing and not enough time learning.  Exams were challenging, but read the stuff and you'll be fine.

Steven is an Awesome prof! His lectures are super funny and interesting. I had this class at 8:30 in the morning and I didn't fall asleep. If you read the study guide, you'll do fine on his exams.... he even gives you the essay questions. Definately take this class with him.

hilarious man. it does tend to take him 2 full hours to get through what any other prof could cover in 15 minutes, but that's because he's telling tons of funny stories & swearing lots. absolutely lovable, just make sure you read the text or else you'll fail

His lectures are not helpful cause the exam questions are solely based on reading material (which includes an enormous amount of articles).  However, he's extremely funny at lectures.  Memorize the reading material and you'd be okay.  And the project on serial killers was fun.
very interesting and charismatic. tests are easy. get the study guide for the text and you'll have no problems!!
No Comments

Really good instructor, funny, gives good examples and the lectures are interesting and never boring.  Gives good examples.  Tests are a little hard with a usual average of 66%, also he doesn't have office hours so hard to track down.
Very entertaining lectures. Utilizes a lot of his life experience to explain the material. Tells great stories and is funny too. A lot of reading in the class though, but no papers.
